title: Why Mexico is losing its war against a parallel state of drug cartels
text:
Even for Mexico, which has become synonymous with cartel violence and drug trafficking around the world, last week was unprecedented.

A botched military operation by the government of Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador (Amlo) that briefly detained the son of Joaquin “El Chapo” Guzmán, Ovidio - an alleged truck trafficker - was forced to release him and retreat.

On Thursday afternoon, cartel henchmen paralysed the city of Culiacán and surrounded the house in which the younger Guzmán – a power in the Sinaloa Cartel criminal empire – was being held, vastly outnumbering the soldiers inside.

The gunmen threatened to massacre those who were holding him if he wasn’t set free.
